describe: Trinidad and Tobago is a twin-island country located at the southernmost tip of the Caribbean, known for its vibrant culture, diverse ecosystems, and rich history. The islands boast a mix of African, Indian, European, and indigenous influences, which are reflected in its music, festivals, and cuisine.

cities.name: üèù Port of Spain
cities.geographical_location: Located on the northwest coast of Trinidad.
cities.climate: Tropical climate with a wet season from June to December and a dry season from January to May.

cities.name: üèî San Fernando
cities.geographical_location: Situated in the southwestern part of Trinidad.
cities.climate: Tropical climate with a distinct wet and dry season.
cities.famous_cuisine: Pelau, bake and shark, and corn soup.

cities.name: üèù Scarborough
cities.geographical_location: Located on the southern coast of Tobago.
cities.climate: Tropical climate, generally warm and humid throughout the year.
cities.famous_cuisine: Crab and dumplings, curried goat, and fish broth.
